column2: 1. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column8: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column6: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column2: 3. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column10: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.

column2: 4. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column10: have a beer or two to keep you awake.

column2: 9. At night, it is hardest to see:
10. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when it is hard to see ahead.
column8: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 11. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 12. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column6: Take a cold shower before driving.
column8: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 13. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: only on the left and right side
the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 21. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 22. While driving, it is important to slow down:

column4: the lane to the left may pass.
column6: passing is permitted in either direction.

column2: 25. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column6: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column8: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column10: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.

column6: You may proceed only if the way is clear

34. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.

column2: 35. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:

column4: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column8: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 38. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
39. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, air horn or a red or blue flashing light, drivers must move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.

column6: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
